comments.content: I have had a thought in the past if one day old still photographs could only be animated and here we are. I am very impressed with the result; just stunning

Combined this with virtual reality and we'll  have virtual time travel. But I think the real potential of the technologies will be for story telling--film makers take notice.

Very good animation to bring to life again from Still photographs of the time! There's a great need for millions of old photo's to be done this way and a whole new film/video industry specifically for this method by the producer? Great Stuff!

Fantastic. Everything now in film is amazing. But the most amazing of all is good understanding of basic photography, without it there is nothing

Strangely evocative. Comforting and creepy at the same time. Even w new "animation" images like these are so distorted because of the technology of original capture. Feels like viewing thru nostalgic lens, not the living breathing world of that bustling "modern" era
I've always been fascinated by the mood, the history, and the music of that "between the wars" era. So many meta- changes in such a short period of time.

How miraculous is this,enjoying this video playing on  my Samsung note 4 phone, wonderful to be looking  at Architecture and life,  from the last century,  so beautifully photographed and edited.  Thank you to all who made this film,  and to all of you who has posted it.

This is similar to what the Milwaukee Public Museum did as the new entrance to "The Streets of Old Milwaukee" exhibit. You walk through a streetcar and the pictures outside the windows are the streets (with animated people, animals, vehicles, etc going backwards in time (the buildings, costumes on people, cars, etc.). It is very cool.
Like going back in time a hundred years. Really great. Loved the working fan in the pharmacy. And the shadows cast by people walking. Brilliant.
imagin doing all that work to build all that back then when they did.t have the equipment to do it like they have now..those people were the greatests. generation

Everything was so well made then and it's striking the difference without all the street signs and parking lines and adverts and cheap looking shop fronts and electric lines etc etc. We become blind to all the extraneous shit around us now. description: Joshua Gordon I wish to be clear I am not looking for sympathy. I am righteously angry. No doubt at all many of you have similar or worse stories.  My wife and I are caring for a Vietnam vet 3 nights a week, and during the day as possible, that doesn't "qualify" for full time care. He has a colostomy bag, is a paraplegic, has one barely functional hand, and goes to dialysis 3 days a week. The insurance has no problem paying 8k EVERY time he goes to dialysis. I could go on.....ok, I will. He has had 16 surgeries this past year billed out to insurance at an astronomical rate. But 2-3k a month for an assisted living facility? Nope, not qualified. We have obtained an advocate for him that may, after months of work, get him a Medicare grant to enable this. In the meantime he suffers alone often, slowly dying, because we can't always be there.
